name: Medicines A to Z
description: Find out how your medicine works, how and when to take it, possible side effects and answers to your common questions.

significantLink.name: Glyceryl trinitrate (GTN)
significantLink.description: Find out how glyceryl trinitrate (GTN) treats angina (chest pain) and anal fissures and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Haloperidol
significantLink.description: Find out how haloperidol treats mental health conditions and feeling or being sick, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Heparinoid
significantLink.description: Find out how heparinoid treats bruising, haematoma and vein inflammation (superficial thrombophlebitis) and how to use it.

significantLink.name: Hormone replacement therapy (HRT)
significantLink.description: Find information about HRT for menopause symptoms, including the types of HRT, benefits and risks and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone – what it is used for, side effects, dosage and who can take it.

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone buccal tablets
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone buccal tablets – what they're used for, who can take them, how to take them, side effects and dosage.

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone for piles and itchy bottom – what it's used for, side effects, dosage and who can use it.

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone for skin
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone skin cream, ointment and lotion - what it’s used for, who can use it, how to apply it, side effects and dosage.

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone injections
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone injections – what they're used for, side effects, and who can have them

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone rectal foam
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone rectal foam – this medicine has been discontinued.

significantLink.name: Hydrocortisone tablets
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on hydrocortisone tablets – what they're used for, who can take them,  how to take them, side effects and dosage

significantLink.name: Hydroxocobalamin
significantLink.description: Find out how hydroxocobalamin treats and prevents vitamin B12 deficiency anaemia, and how you'll have it.

significantLink.name: Hydroxychloroquine
significantLink.description: Find out how hydroxychloroquine treats inflammatory conditions including rheumatoid arthritis and skin conditions, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Hyoscine hydrobromide (Kwells and Joy-Rides)
significantLink.description: Find out how hyoscine hydrobromide treats travel sickness and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Ibuprofen and codeine
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on ibuprofen and codeine – what it’s used for, side effects, dosage and who can take it.

significantLink.name: Ibuprofen for adults (Nurofen)
significantLink.description: Other brand names: Brufen, Calprofen, Fenbid, Ibugel, Ibuleve. Find out how ibuprofen treats pain and swelling (inflammation), and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Ibuprofen for children
significantLink.description: Find out how ibuprofen for children treats pain and inflammation (swelling) including cold symptoms, teething, toothache, sprains and strains, and reduces a high temperature, and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Indapamide
significantLink.description: Brand names: Natrilix, Indipam, Rawel, Tensaid, Alkapamid. Find out how indapamide treats high blood pressure and how to take it.

significantLink.name: Insulin
significantLink.description: Find information about types of insulin and how to take it for type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes and gestational diabetes.

significantLink.name: Irbesartan
significantLink.description: Brand name: Aprovel. Find out how irbesartan treats high blood pressure (hypertension) and helps to prevent the risk of strokes, heart attacks and kidney problems.

significantLink.name: Isosorbide mononitrate and isosorbide dinitrate
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on isosorbide mononitrate and isosorbide dinitrate – what they're used for, side effects, dosage and who can take them.

significantLink.name: Isotretinoin capsules (Roaccutane)
significantLink.description: Other brand names: Rizuderm, Reticutan. Find out how isotretinoin capsules treat acne and how to take them.

significantLink.name: Isotretinoin gel (Isotrex)
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on isotretinoin gel (Isotrex) – this medicine has been discontinued.

significantLink.name: Ketoconazole
significantLink.description: NHS medicines information on ketoconazole – what it's used for, side effects, dosage and who can use it.

significantLink.name: Labetalol
significantLink.description: Brand name: Trandate. Find out how labetalol treats high blood pressure (hypertension) including high blood pressure in pregnancy and angina, and how to take it.
